node.title: Videos of high school student brawl sparks investigation
node.alt: Mobile phone image of students fighting.
node.description: Tasmania Police are investigating after footage emerged of a fight involving a large number of students at a Hobart high school, with a cyber-bullying expert warning the videosÂ being circulated will only add to the harm.
node.content:
["Tasmania Police are investigating after a video emerged of a fight involving a large number of students at a Hobart high school.", "At least two\u00a0videos \u2014\u00a0which have\u00a0been shared widely on social media \u2014\u00a0appeared to show a large group of students watching on as one of their male classmates was verbally and physically harassed on Tuesday.", "That\u00a0group then followed\u00a0the student across the school grounds, yelling and taunting him as he tried\u00a0to escape.", "The ABC has chosen to not publish the videos.", "In a statement, Tasmania's Department of Education confirmed the incident took place at New Town High School yesterday, and that action had been taken against the students involved.", "\"School staff responded quickly to support the student and his family, and will continue to provide ongoing support,\" the statement said.\u00a0", "Minister for Education Sarah Courtney was also been advised of the incident.", "\"Violence in any form is completely unacceptable within our communities, and not tolerated in our schools,\" Ms Courtney said.", "\"I am advised the school took immediate action on this serious incident, with disciplinary sanctions put in place, and the matter now being investigated by Tasmania Police.\"", "", "
One of the videos included banners urging people to \"share this video\".(Supplied)
", "
Harassment goes beyond school gates
", "Susan McLean\u00a0is a cyber-safety expert and a former Victorian police officer.", "Ms McLean said\u00a0the sharing of videos of incidents such as\u00a0this online only served\u00a0to magnify the humiliation and harm caused by making the incident\u00a0public.", "\"Psychological harm is equal to, if not more hurtful or harmful, than a physical assault, because your bruise will heal, but that torment goes on and on.\" Ms McLean said.", "The damage was not limited to the victim, Ms McLean added, with names of alleged perpetrators shared online, often to encourage retribution.", "She said\u00a0that, when things were\u00a0shared in small cities and towns, such as\u00a0Hobart, the impact was often worse.\u00a0", "\"If something happens like this in suburban Sydney or Melbourne it will be shared, but the spread and reach won't be as great,\" Ms McLean said.", "\"When it happens in Tasmania, it gets tagged with different names, locations, schools, the offender's\u00a0name, the victim's name, and it takes on a life of its own.\"", "
'Bully follows you home'
", "Ms McLean said\u00a0that, by virtue of technology, the \"bully follows you home, into your house, and into the one place you should be safe, your bedroom\".", "Ms Courtney said\u00a080 additional professional support staff have been added to Tasmanian schools since 2014.", "The government has also announced $22 million to help students impacted by trauma, but Ms McLean said\u00a0education was the key.", "\"We need the bystanders not to join in, by liking and sharing, but [to] immediately speak up,\" she said.", "\"Always report content to the platforms\u00a0and, of course, when we're talking about criminal activity, involve the police.\""]
